fields.description:
All import instance/image tests failing in CI while using Ceph as the OSG backend...

Update:
I was also able to reproduce manually against a Walrus backed system. 


{code}
[02-08 19:34:38][DEBUG][10.111.5.10:(['CLC'])]: precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0   (  1/205)   0% ||   0.00  B   0.00  B/s ETA:  --:--:--
[02-08 19:34:38][DEBUG][10.111.5.10:(['CLC'])]: precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0   (  1/205) 100% ||  10.00 MB 207.77 MB/s Time: 0:00:00

euca-import-instance: error: connection error (('Connection aborted.', error(104, 'Connection reset by peer')))

[02-08 19:34:38][DEBUG][10.111.5.10:(['CLC'])]: done with exec
[02-08 19:34:38][DEBUG][10.111.5.10:(['CLC'])]: ['Uploading image for task import-i-4272c618', 'precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0   (  1/205)   0% ||   0.00  B   0.00  B/s ETA:  --:--:--', 'precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0   (  1/205) 100% ||  10.00 MB 207.77 MB/s Time: 0:00:00', '', "euca-import-instance: error: connection error (('Connection aborted.', error(104, 'Connection reset by peer')))"]

    out = machine.sys(cmd=cmd, timeout=timeout, code=0)
  File "/mnt/nephoria_test_template/envnephoria/lib/python2.7/site-packages/adminapi-1.4.3.0.1.1-py2.7.egg/cloud_utils/system_utils/machine.py", line 438, in sys
    code=code)
  File "/mnt/nephoria_test_template/envnephoria/lib/python2.7/site-packages/adminapi-1.4.3.0.1.1-py2.7.egg/cloud_utils/net_utils/sshconnection.py", line 449, in sys
    status=out['status'])
CommandExitCodeException: 'Cmd:euca-import-instance /disk1/storage/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img -b eutester_import_precise-server- -z one -f raw -t c1.medium -a x86_64 -p Linux --show-empty-fields  -g import_instance_test_group --key ImportInstanceTests_key_1486582475.7 --s3-url http://s3.h-14.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ -U http://ec2.h-14.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --user-data "#cloud-config\ndisable_root: false" -I AKIAAZQFBCJ22MVVFKX3 -S Gh87lIU9iC5rOoYRFWDD4DjHdXBqWfQAndJj3Zuf failed with status code:1, output:[\'Uploading image for task import-i-4272c618\', \'precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0   (  1/205)   0% ||   0.00  B   0.00  B/s ETA:  --:--:--\', \'precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0   (  1/205) 100% ||  10.00 MB 207.77 MB/s Time: 0:00:00\', \'\', "euca-import-instance: error: connection error ((\'Connection aborted.\', error(104, \'Connection reset by peer\')))"]'

comments.body:
Easy to reproduce on a ceph setup...


{code}
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-import-instance /disk1/storage/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img -b eutester_import_precise-server- -z one -f raw -t c1.medium -a x86_64 -p Linux --show-empty-fields  -g import_i  --user-data "#cloud-config\ndis^Cle_root: false"
Uploading image for task import-i-74e3117c
precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0   (  1/205) 100% |==========================================================================================|  10.00 MB 207.65 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
euca-import-instance: error: connection error (('Connection aborted.', error(104, 'Connection reset by peer')))
[root@h-10 ~]# 
[root@h-10 ~]# 
[root@h-10 ~]# 
[root@h-10 ~]# 
[root@h-10 ~]# 
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-import-instance /disk1/storage/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img -b eutester_import_precise-server- -z one -f raw -t c1.medium -a x86_64 -p Linux --show-empty-fields   --user-data "#cloud-config\ndis^Cle_root: false"
Uploading image for task import-i-341e3db3
precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0   (  1/205) 100% |==========================================================================================|  10.00 MB 207.97 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
euca-import-instance: error: connection error (('Connection aborted.', error(104, 'Connection reset by peer')))

{code}

Some additional testing shows that imports work for images of ~300k, at ~500k we get an error regarding the content length being exceeded, and at >~900k the connection just gets reset. 
Tests below...

{code}
[root@d-02 ~]# head -c 300000 /dev/zero |  dd of=testfile
585+1 records in
585+1 records out
300000 bytes (300 kB) copied, 0.00181544 s, 165 MB/s
[root@d-02 ~]# euca-import-instance testfile -b mattestbucket -z one -f raw -t c1.medium -a x86_64 -p Linux --show-empty-fields 
Uploading image for task import-i-8141801e
testfile.part.0 100% |=====================================================================================================================================| 292.97 kB   1.98 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
TaskType	IMPORTINSTANCE	TaskId	import-i-8141801e	ExpirationTime	Wed Feb 15 16:31:13 PST 2017	Status	active
DISKIMAGE	DiskImageFormat	RAW	DiskImageSize	300000	VolumeSize	1	AvailabilityZone	one	ApproximateBytesConverted	0	Status	active
[root@d-02 ~]# 
[root@d-02 ~]# 
[root@d-02 ~]# head -c 500000 /dev/zero |  dd of=testfile
976+1 records in
976+1 records out
500000 bytes (500 kB) copied, 0.00268615 s, 186 MB/s
[root@d-02 ~]# euca-import-instance testfile -b mattestbucket -z one -f raw -t c1.medium -a x86_64 -p Linux --show-empty-fields 
Uploading image for task import-i-f9b99518
testfile.part.0 100% |=====================================================================================================================================| 488.28 kB   9.88 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
euca-import-instance: error (400 Bad Request): HTTP content length exceeded 307200 bytes.
[root@d-02 ~]# head -c 1000000 /dev/zero |  dd of=testfile
1953+1 records in
1953+1 records out
1000000 bytes (1.0 MB) copied, 0.00526707 s, 190 MB/s
[root@d-02 ~]# euca-import-instance testfile -b mattestbucket -z one -f raw -t c1.medium -a x86_64 -p Linux --show-empty-fields 
Uploading image for task import-i-589132c5
testfile.part.0 100% |=====================================================================================================================================| 976.56 kB  19.13 MB/s Time: 0:00:00
euca-import-instance: error: connection error (('Connection aborted.', error(104, 'Connection reset by peer')))

{code}

This issue might have a euca2ools and a eucalyptus part to it. 
I've opened TOOLS-676 to track the tools side. The tools include an extra/unintentional param which is likely the underlying cause of the import failures. 
This also may have introduced another issue. The extra param in the request causes the request to be handled as a metadata request/pipeline. [~jhalterman] can probably provide more info. 
Thanks!
-M

This is caused by an image upload request winding up in the metadata request pipeline, which rejects requests with payloads > 300K (by default). The logic that determines whether a request is metadata or not assumes that a request with parameters which do not include a (multi-part) uploadId or partNumber, or satisfy some other criteria, are metadata requests. In this case, an internal parameter was unintentionally being added to the request by euca2ools which was causing it to be treated as a metadata request.

[~jhalterman], do we need to wait for TOOLS-676 or this should without the tools fix?

I am still seeing this issue,

{code}
2017-02-10 23:03:16,316 DEBUG   HmacV1Auth string to sign: 'PUT\n\n\nSat, 11 Feb 2017 07:03:16 -0000\n/eutester_import_precise-server-/a1e0963d-5114-4fbd-946b-c28b9f10d7b7//disk1/storage/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0'
2017-02-10 23:03:16,316 DEBUG   HmacV1Auth b64-encoded signature: DftITUoFfuc6POcdIc/7kYbX6co=
2017-02-10 23:03:16,316 DEBUG   S3 request  method: PUT
2017-02-10 23:03:16,316 DEBUG   S3 request  url:    http://s3.g-26-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/eutester_import_precise-server-/a1e0963d-5114-4fbd-946b-c28b9f10d7b7//disk1/storage/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0?progressbar_label=precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0+++%28++1%2F205%29
2017-02-10 23:03:16,316 DEBUG   S3 request  header: Accept: */*
2017-02-10 23:03:16,317 DEBUG   S3 request  header: Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
2017-02-10 23:03:16,317 DEBUG   S3 request  header: Authorization: AWS AKIAA2TRKL3KEN3H5U5K:DftITUoFfuc6POcdIc/7kYbX6co=
2017-02-10 23:03:16,317 DEBUG   S3 request  header: Connection: keep-alive
2017-02-10 23:03:16,317 DEBUG   S3 request  header: Content-Length: 10485760
2017-02-10 23:03:16,317 DEBUG   S3 request  header: Date: Sat, 11 Feb 2017 07:03:16 -0000
2017-02-10 23:03:16,317 DEBUG   S3 request  header: Host: s3.g-26-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773
2017-02-10 23:03:16,317 DEBUG   S3 request  header: User-Agent: euca2ools/3.4.1-1-gf960997 (CPython 2.7.5; Linux 3.10.0-514.6.1.el7.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.7.1 requests/2.6.0
2017-02-10 23:03:16,317 DEBUG   S3 request  param:  progressbar_label: precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0   (  1/205)
2017-02-10 23:03:16,321 DEBUG   S3 connection error
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 184, in send_request
    allow_redirects=False)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 576, in send
    r = adapter.send(request, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 424, in send
    raise ConnectionError(e, request=request)
ConnectionError: HTTPConnectionPool(host='s3.g-26-10.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com', port=8773): Max retries exceeded with url: /eutester_import_precise-server-/a1e0963d-5114-4fbd-946b-c28b9f10d7b7//disk1/storage/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0?progressbar_label=precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.part.0+++%28++1%2F205%29 (Caused by ProtocolError('Connection aborted.', error(104, 'Connection reset by peer')))
{code}
(complete log attached [^import_instance.log.bz2] )

*Installed Packages*
{code}
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.4.0
Release     : 0.25799.155.20170210git7cba268.el7
Size        : 242 k
Repo        : installed
{code}

[~shaon] That could be a similar but unrelated issue. The problem here was where requests for data uploads wound up in the metadata pipeline, and would yield an error "HTTP content length exceeded". I've been able to successfully upload images, though much smaller, in Matt's original environment.

Can you give a better idea what's going on in the log? It looks like a large upload is performed followed by another attempt which fails?
[~jhalterman], is a change to OSGUtil#isPUTDataRequest required? (similar to the change made in OSGUtil#isPUTMetadataRequest)
[~sjones] That could be the case. Will see if that resolves things for Shaon..
[~shaon] The change that Steve mentioned did allow me to do an upload on your cluster (after verifying that it failed previously). So things look good there!

Verified.

*Installed Packages*
{code}
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.4.0
Release     : 0.25803.158.20170214git2bb3174.el7
Size        : 242 k
Repo        : installed
{code}
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
